actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to prohibit the disclosure of an individual's social security number without his consent unless specifically required by law, and to provide that (unless so required) no individual may be compelled to permit the use of his social security number for any purpose not directly related to the operation of the old-age, survivors, and disability insurance program.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Prohibits, under the Social Security Act, the disclosure of an individual's social security number without his consent unless specifically required by law. Provides that, unless so required, no individual may be compelled to permit the use of his social security number for any purpose not directly related to the operation of the old-age, survivors, and disability insurance program.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to prohibit the disclosure of an individual's social security number without his consent unless specifically required by law, and to provide that (unless so required) no individual may be compelled to permit the use of his social security number for any purpose not directly related to the operation of the old-age, survivors, and disability insurance program.
